items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Further light rainfall is forecast through today, 21/06/21. 
We continue to monitor the situation. 
Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are high but steady on the River Thame following recent heavy rainfall. River levels on the Chalgrove Brook are below the flood risk threshold. Therefore, flooding of low-lying land, footpaths and roads is expected to continue, especially in the Thame area. 
Further rainfall is forecast today, 21/06/21, before clearing in the evening with a largely dry night into tomorrow 22/06/21. River levels have peaked and will remain steady, with no further rise forecast.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area carrying out checks in key areas which may pose a flood risk. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings, and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 22/06/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Blackwater and The Cove Brook
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. The flood forecast has changed significantly in the Cove Brook area. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area. 
We continue to monitor the situation. 
Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels are high but steady on the River Kennet following a period of sustained rainfall. Therefore, the risk of flooding remains, especially in the areas close to Hungerford. 
Further rainfall is forecast today, 21/06/21, before clearing in the evening with a largely dry night into tomorrow 22/06/21. We expect river levels to remain largely steady today with forecast rainfall, but levels could rise if areas see higher rainfall totals.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area carrying out checks in key areas which may pose a flood risk.  
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings, and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 22/06/21, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area. Further light rainfall is forecast over this afternoon, 21/06/21. 
We continue to monitor the situation. 
Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. The rain forecasted this morning has not had a significant effect on river levels, as a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area. Further light rainfall is forecast through the day. 
We continue to monitor the situation. 
Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary. Further rainfall is forecast in the early hours of the morning, but is not expected to increase the river levels significantly. 
We continue to monitor the situation. 
Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

items.description: River Loddon and River Blackwater at Swallowfield
items.message:
This Flood Warning has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. The flood warning for the area has now been removed. However, a flood alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding may still affect roads and low lying land. Further light rainfall is forecast over this afternoon. 
We continue to monitor the situation. 
Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are forecast to rise on the River Loddon as a result of heavy rainfall. 
Further rainfall is forecast in the early hours of the morning, 21/06/21. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow 21/06/21, or as the situation changes.
